title: Did you know?
text: Bikol is famous for its love of spicy food
image: especially dishes cooked in coconut milk with siling labuyo like Bicol Express and laing.

title: Did you know?
text: The region celebrates the Peñafrancia Festival in Naga City every September
image: one of the largest Marian celebrations in the Philippines.

title: Did you know?
text: Mayon Volcano in Albay is known worldwide for its near-perfect cone and shapes much of the region's landscape and culture.

title: Did you know?
text: Bikol weavers in towns like Iriga and Baao are known for traditional abaca (hemp) crafts and textiles.

title: Did you know?
text: Bikolano hospitality shows in fiestas and community meals called “pabasa” and “katigbak
image: ” where neighbors share food and stories.
